intro: Bathysa pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican burr plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive seed pods. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, followed by the development of spiny, woody pods. Its seeds are encased in a thick, persistent husk that aids in seed dispersal through attachment to animals or clothing. Bathysa pittieri is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
